page.title: 06Stanpit Marsh
page.content: Tidal salt marsh with fresh water feeder stream.Ground composed of mud,sand and shingle banks.Subject to both tidal and river flooding with ice coverings in winter.Rich in rare and common flowering plants,reeds,gorse. Bounded by elders,poplars,willows, bramble and blackberries.Interlaced with streams and patchwork of salt pools,holding bass and mullet fry. Adjacent refuse tip has introduced various garden plants.Resident mammals -voles,rats,rabbits,stoats,polecat ferrets and feral cats.Resident birds- curlew,redshank,snipe,dunlin,lapwing, oyster catcher,plover,mallard,shelduck teal,widgeon,common and little terns. Hunting visitors-fox,barn owl,heron, mink,10 species of bat.Seasonal visitors-osprey,whimbrel,golden-eye, wild geese.Ecological balance affect- ed by fuel pollution,drainage and use
